title: Honda City Sport launched at Rs 14.89 lakh
description: The Honda City Sport has launched in India at an introductory price of Rs 14.89 lakh as a new, limited-run mid-spec variant. The new Sport variant is available with the same 1.5-litre engine as the rest of the range; however, it is available only with a CVT, sits above the entry-level City V CVT variant, and features cosmetic changes on the inside and outside. The launch confirms our report from last year that the City Sport edition was in the works. Honda City Sport exterior gets blacked-out elements City Sport interior features blacked-out bits with contrasting red highlights It is mechanically identical to other variants Honda City Sport price and features It costs Rs 49,000 more than the V CVT variant Honda City prices, ex-showroom, Delhi (in Rs, lakh)VariantManualCVTSV12.38-V13.1514.40Sport-14.89VX14.2115.47ZX15.4016.65 During the introductory period, the City Sport costs Rs 49,000 more than the V CVT variant. Besides the cosmetic changes listed below, the City Sport gets two additional features over the V variant: a 7-colour ambient lighting system and leatherette upholstery on the seat, steering and gear knob. The rest of the features list and safety kit is the same, with highlights including the ADAS suite, front fog lights, auto headlights, wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay connectivity for the 8-inch touchscreen infotainment, keyless entry and go, and paddle shifters. The Sport misses out on features like the sunroof, rear AC vents, 4 tweeters (it makes do with just 4 speakers), the lane watch camera, the 7-inch digital instrument cluster, auto wipers, and an auto-dimming inside rear view mirror. Honda City Sport exterior changes The grille, rear spoiler, and alloy wheels get dark treatment The blacked-out bits on the City Sport include the grille, boot spoiler, the alloy wheels, ‘shark fin’ antenna, and outside rear view mirror covers. The variant also gets a Sport badge to differentiate it from the rest of the range. Honda offers this limited edition variant in three colour options: Radiant Red Metallic, Platinum White Pearl and Meteoroid Gray Metallic. Honda City Sport interior changes Leatherette upholstery is black, with red highlights On the inside, the blacked-out elements include the upholstery, the doors, the roof and the pillars, along with red highlights on the seats, door inserts and steering wheel. The dashboard also gets red trimming, while the AC vents are finished in a glossy black plastic. Honda City Sport engine and gearbox 121hp, 1.5-litre petrol engine and 7-step CVT unchanged As mentioned above, the City Sport has the same 121hp, 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine and 7-step CVT as the rest of the midsize sedan's range. Other than the base SV variant, which is manual only, all other variants get the manual gearbox and CVT option.      All prices, ex-showroom, Delhi Also see: Hyundai Verna vs Honda City comparison: Battle of the automatics Honda Elevate gets discounts worth Rs 70,000 and above in May Honda Civic Type R Ultimate Edition revealed as limited-run swansong

html:
City Sport is a limited-run mid-spec variant that gets cosmetic changes.

The Honda City Sport has launched in India at an introductory price of Rs 14.89 lakh as a new, limited-run mid-spec variant. The new Sport variant is available with the same 1.5-litre engine as the rest of the range; however, it is available only with a CVT, sits above the entry-level City V CVT variant, and features cosmetic changes on the inside and outside. The launch confirms our report from last year that the City Sport edition was in the works.

  1. Honda City Sport exterior gets blacked-out elements
  2. City Sport interior features blacked-out bits with contrasting red highlights
  3. It is mechanically identical to other variants

Honda City Sport price and features

It costs Rs 49,000 more than the V CVT variant

Honda City prices, ex-showroom, Delhi (in Rs, lakh)
VariantManualCVT

V13.1514.40
Sport-14.89
VX14.2115.47
ZX15.4016.65

During the introductory period, the City Sport costs Rs 49,000 more than the V CVT variant. Besides the cosmetic changes listed below, the City Sport gets two additional features over the V variant: a 7-colour ambient lighting system and leatherette upholstery on the seat, steering and gear knob. The rest of the features list and safety kit is the same, with highlights including the ADAS suite, front fog lights, auto headlights, wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay connectivity for the 8-inch touchscreen infotainment, keyless entry and go, and paddle shifters.

The Sport misses out on features like the sunroof, rear AC vents, 4 tweeters (it makes do with just 4 speakers), the lane watch camera, the 7-inch digital instrument cluster, auto wipers, and an auto-dimming inside rear view mirror.

Honda City Sport exterior changes

The grille, rear spoiler, and alloy wheels get dark treatment

The blacked-out bits on the City Sport include the grille, boot spoiler, the alloy wheels, ‘shark fin’ antenna, and outside rear view mirror covers. The variant also gets a Sport badge to differentiate it from the rest of the range. Honda offers this limited edition variant in three colour options: Radiant Red Metallic, Platinum White Pearl and Meteoroid Gray Metallic.

Honda City Sport interior changes

Leatherette upholstery is black, with red highlights

On the inside, the blacked-out elements include the upholstery, the doors, the roof and the pillars, along with red highlights on the seats, door inserts and steering wheel. The dashboard also gets red trimming, while the AC vents are finished in a glossy black plastic.

Honda City Sport engine and gearbox

121hp, 1.5-litre petrol engine and 7-step CVT unchanged

As mentioned above, the City Sport has the same 121hp, 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine and 7-step CVT as the rest of the midsize sedan's range. Other than the base SV variant, which is manual only, all other variants get the manual gearbox and CVT option.     

All prices, ex-showroom, Delhi
